name: Celebrate Spooky Season with These Book and Movie Recommendations from County Library
description: Are you looking for a spooky book or movie to help you get in the Halloween spirit?

affiliation.name: County of San Diego Communications Office

articleContent:
Are you looking for a spooky book or movie to help you get in the Halloween spirit?
The San Diego County Library has you covered with several lists of ghostly movies and books to help you embrace the spooky season.
From Stephen King’s latest horror novel to a Charlie Brown classic, the Library has a story or film to help you have a scary good time, regardless of age.
Here’s a list of the Library’s top 5 scary movies for adults:

Scream VI
Beau is Afraid
The Menu
Knock at the Cabin
Evil Dead Rise

And the Library’s top 5 Halloween movies for the kids to enjoy:

The Secret of NIMH
The Adventures of Ichabod and Mr. Toad
It’s the Great Pumpkin, Charlie Brown
Scooby-Doo! Return to Zombie Island
Wallace and Gromit: Curse of the Were-Rabbit

These are the Library’s top 5 Horror books for adults:

Silver Nitrate by Silvia Moreno-Garcia
Holly by Stephen King
How to Sell a Haunted House by Grady Hendrix
Bad Cree by Jessica Johns
A Certain Hunger by Chelsea G. Summers

And the top 5 most popular Halloween books for kids:

A Super Scary Narwhalloween by Ben Clanton
Creepy Crayon by Aaron Reynolds
Rowley Jefferson’s Awesome Friendly Spooky Stories by Jeff Kinney
Fly Guy and Fly Girl: Night Fright by Tedd Arnold
Bruce and the Legend of Soggy Hallow by Ryan T. Higgins

Check out the Library’s This is Halloween! collection for even more spooky ebooks and audiobooks.
You can head to the Library’s movie page for even more titles and staff list recommendations.
Have a happy and safe Halloween!
